title: What you need to know about Foot-and-Mouth Disease.

tasks.task: Understanding and managing Foot and Mouth Disease (FMD)
subtasks: Recognizing symptoms in different animal types (cattle, pigs, sheep, goats)
Identifying methods of virus transmission (contact, contaminated materials, clothing, vehicles)
Reporting suspected cases to a veterinarian or local authority
Implementing quarantine measures (limiting animal and person movement)
Cooperating with authorities for disease confirmation and containment
Maintaining cleanliness of clothing, footwear, and equipment
Avoiding contact with infected animals or contaminated materials
Properly handling and cooking animal products
Monitoring weather conditions that may aid virus spread
Reporting any suspected cases immediately to prevent disease spread

tasks.task: Staying alert and reporting suspected cases. This prevents spreading. So to structure this, the MAINTASK would be Understanding and managing FMD, split into recognizing symptoms, knowing transmission methods, reporting procedures, and containment. The Preventing the spread of FMD MAINTASK would have subtasks like maintaining hygiene, avoiding contact, cooking, and monitoring weather.
